page.title: 20Glebe Farm Hanworth (cont.)
page.content: Over 200 acres of top quality land produce sugar-beet,winter wheat,spring and winter barley,dwarf-beans and potatoes. Sugar-beet is sowed on contract to the Royal Sugar-Beet cooperation. 60 acres barley are sold to the malting industry while the winter wheat is sold for animal feed. Beans are harvested by the local farmerÂ£s cooperative for freezing,while potatoes also grown under contract are sold to Ross freezers for chips,or on open market after being stored till April and graded. Fodder beet is grown for sheep and cattle while extract from the malting of barley is bought back for cattle feed. All straw is used for winter bedding for cattle,pigs and sheep. Because of the vast amount of modern machinery, this farm is self- sufficient and is worked by the farmer, his wife,2 sons and 2 employees.
